Text: #G10# As a site member, I want to describe myself on my own page in a semi-structured way, so that others can learn about me.
Action: Describe On Own Page In A Structured Way

Text: #G10# As a site member, I want to fill out an application to become a Certified Scrum Practitioner, so that I can earn that designation.
Action: Fill Out An To Application A Certified Scrum Practitioner

Text: #G10# As a Practitioner, I want to include additional details about me in my profile page, so that I can showcase my experience.
Action: Include Additional Details About In Profile Page

Text: #G10# As a site member, I want to fill out an application to become a Certified Scrum Trainer, so that I can teach CSM and CSPO courses and certify others.
Action: Fill Out An To Application A Certified Scrum Trainer

Text: #G10# As a Trainer, I want to include additional details in my profile page about me, so that others can learn about me and decide if I am the right trainer for them.
Action: Include Additional Details In Page Profile Page About

Text: #G10# As a Practitioner, I want to write an article for the site with a small graphic shown with the article showing my CSP or CST status, so that others know my certifications when reading.
Action: Write An Article For The Site With A Small Graphic With

Text: #G10# As a trainer, I want to list my upcoming classes in my profile and include a link to a detailed page about each, so that prospective attendees can find my courses.
Action: Include A Link To A Detailed Page About Each

Text: #G10# As a site member, I want to view the profiles of other members, so that I can find others I might want to connect with.
Action: View The Profiles Of Other Members

Text: #G10# As a site member, I want to search for profiles based on a few fields, so that I can find others I might want to connect with.
Action: Search For Profiles On A Few Fields

Text: #G10# As a site member, I want to mark my profile as private in which case only my name will appear, so that no one can learn things about me I don't want shared.
#G10# As a site member, I want to mark my email address as private even if the rest of my profile is not, so that no one can contact me.
#G10# As a site member, I want to send an email to any member via a form, so that we can connect.
Action: Send An Email To Any Member Via A Form

Text: #G10# As a site administrator, I want to read practicing and training applications and approve or reject them, so that only applicants who qualify can become CSPs or CSTs.
#G10# As a site administrator, I want to edit any site member profile, so that I can correct problems for members.
#G10# As a site visitor, I want to read current news on the home page, so that I stay current on agile news.
Action: Read Current News On The Home Page

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to access old news that is no longer on the home page, so that I can access things I remember from the past or that others mention to me.
Action: Access Old News Longer Is No On The Home Page

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to email news items to the editor, so that they can be considered for publication.
Action: Email News Items To The Editor

Text: #G10# As a site editor, I want to set the following dates on a news item: Start Publishing Date, Old News Date, Stop Publishing Date, so that articles are published on and through appropriate dates.
Action: Set The Following Dates On A News Item

Text: #G10# As a site member, I want to subscribe to an RSS feed of news, so that I remain sufficiently and easily informed.
Action: Subscribe To An Rss Feed Of News

Text: #G10# As a site editor, I want to assign priority numbers to news items, so that I can indicate which articles I want featured most prominently on the site.
Action: Assign Priority Numbers To News Items

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to see a list of all upcoming Certification Courses and can page through them if there are a lot, so that I can choose the best course for me.
Action: See A List Of All Upcoming Certification Courses

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to see a list of all upcoming Other Courses and can page through them if necessary, so that I can choose the best course for me.
Action: Page Through A List Of All Upcoming Other Courses

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to see a list of all upcoming Events, so that I can decide if I want to attend any.
Action: See A List Of All Upcoming Events

Text: #G10# As a trainer, I want to create a new course or event, so that site visitors can see it.
#G10# As a trainer, I want to create an Other Course or Event I am charged a listing fee for that activity, so that I don't list events I don't really intend to hold.
Action: Charged A Listing Fee For That Activity

Text: #G10# As a site administrator, I want to create an Other Course or Event that is not charged a listing fee, so that the Scrum Alliance doesn't charge itself for Scrum Gatherings that it puts on.
Action: Create An Other Course Not Charged A Listing Fee

Text: #G10# As a site administrator, I want to set the listing fee per Other Course or Event, so that we have flexibility on what to charge in the future.
Action: Set The Listing Fee Per Other Course

Text: #G10# As a trainer, I want to update one of my existing courses or events, so that it reflects accurate information.
#G10# As a trainer, I want to delete one of my courses or events, so that it's no longer listed if I cancel for some reason.
#G10# As a trainer, I want to copy one of my courses or events, so that I can create a new one.
#G10# As a site admin, I want to delete any course or event, so that I can remove things that will no longer occur.
#G10# As a site editor, I want to update any course or event, so that I can fix things the original author hasn't.
#G10# As a trainer, I want to turn a course into an event or an event into a course, so that I can correctly classify anything that was entered incorrectly.
Action: Turn A Course Into An Event

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to have an advanced search option that lets me fill in a form of search criteria, so that I can quickly find what I am looking for.
Action: Have An Advanced Search Option Lets Fill A Form Of Search Criteria

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to view a course I can click on the trainer's name and be taken to the trainer's profile, so that I can read more about a trainer before registering for a course.
Action: Taken Click On The Trainer's Name To The Trainer's Profile

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to subscribe to an RSS feed of upcoming courses and events, so that I am up to day without having to visit the site.
Action: Subscribe To An Feed Upcoming Event
Subscribe To An Rss Feed Upcoming Courses

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to read FAQs, so that I can get quick answers.
#G10# As a site editor, I want to maintain a FAQ section, so that support gets fewer easily answered questions.
#G10# As a site visitor, I want to do a full-text search of the FAQs, so that I can find an answer quickly.
Action: Do A Full Text Search Of The Faqs

Text: #G10# As a site member, I want to download the latest training material and methodology PDFs, so that I have them.
Action: Methodology The Latest Training Material Pdfs

Text: #G10# As a visitor, I want to download presentations, PDFs, etc. on Scrum, so that I can learn from them or use them.
#G10# As a site member, I want to scroll through a listing of jobs, so that I can see if there any I am interested in.
Action: Scroll Through A Listing Of Jobs

Text: #G10# As a recruiter, I want to post a help wanted ad, so that I can attract candidates.
#G10# As a site admin, I want to approve each help wanted ad before it gets to the site, so that we're sure of the quality of jobs being listed.
#G10# As a site member, I want to subscribe to an RSS feed of jobs available, so that I can read them without visiting the site.
Action: Subscribe To An Rss Feed Of Jobs

Text: #G10# As a site admin, I want to edit and delete help wanted ads, so that I can correct small problems or make sure each ad complies with site guidelines.

#G10# As a site admin, I want to stop publishing jobs on the site 30 days after being posted, so that jobs that may have been filled aren't still listed when the hiring party forgets to come back and delete the ad.
#G10# As a recruiter, I want to be able to extend an ad for another 30 days by visiting the site and updating the posting, so that my ad remains active.
Action: Extend An Ad For Another Days
Extend An Ad For Another Days Visiting The Site

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to read a new article on the front page about once a week, so that I am up on all the latest happenings.
Action: Read A New Article On The Front Page A Week Once

Text: #G10# As the site editor, I want to include a teaser with each article, so that site visitors can decide if they want to read the rest.
Action: Include A Teaser With Each Article

Text: #G10# As a site member who has read a teaser on the front page, I want to read the entire article so that I can finish articles that appeal to me.
#G10# As the site editor, I want to add an article to the site, so that the site has plenty of content.
Action: Add An Article To The Site

Text: #G10# As a site editor, I want to set start publishing dates, old article date, and stop publishing dates for articles, so that articles appear only during appropriate periods.
#G10# As the site editor, I want to have pretty good control over how the article, so that articles are visually appealing.
Action: Have Pretty Good Control Over How The Article

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to click the link from the article teaser to take me directly to the body of the article. not to another teaser setup, so that I can easily finish the article.
Action: Click The Link From The Article Teaser
The Link Take To The Body Of The Article

Text: #G10# As a site editor, I want to be able to indicate whether an article is publicly available or for members only, so that visitors are incentivized to become members.
Action: For Indicate An Article Only Members

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to be able to read some of your articles, so that I can learn without first joining the site.
#G10# As a site member, I want to have full access to all articles, so that there is a benefit to being a member.
Action: Have Full Access To All Articles

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to do a full-text search of article body, title, and author name, so that I can find what I want.
Action: Do A Full Search Of Title
Do A Full Search Of Author Name
Do A Full Text Search Of Article Body

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to subscribe to an RSS feed of articles, so that I can read them without visiting the site.
Action: Subscribe To An Rss Feed Of Articles

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to post comments about articles, so that others can read them.
#G10# As a site editor, I want to have a prominent area on the home page where I can put special announcements not necessarily news or articles, so that I can give them additional exposure.
Action: Have A Prominent Area On The Home Page Not

Text: #G10# As a site editor, I want to have some flexibility as to where things appear, so that I can accommodate different types of content.
Action: Have Some Flexibility Things Where Appear

Text: #G10# As a trainer, I want to see the upcoming courses are what I want visitors to notice, so that they register and there's a benefit to my membership.
#G10# As a site visitor, I want to see new content when I come to the site, so that I come back more often.
#G10# As a site visitor, I want to have articles that interest me and are easy to get to, so that I come to the site for my agile news and learning.
#G10# As a site visitor, I want to be able to get back to the home page quickly and easily, so that I don't get lost navigating.
Action: Easily Get To The Home Page

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to see a list of the most popular items on the site, so that I am most likely to read the most important or best content.
Action: See A List Of The Most Popular Items On The Site

Text: #G10# As a trainer, I want to be assured that no one can submit the same answers multiple time and skew my results, so that my ratings are accurate.
#G10# As a trainer, I want to be notified about the results of surveys about my classes, so that I can read them.
Action: Notified About The Results Of Surveys About Classes

Text: #G10# As a site admin, I want to see the results for each trainer and averages for the class, so that I can identify any outliers or possible problems.
Action: See The Results For Each Trainer For The Class

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to see a trainer's rating, so that I choose a course from an appropriate trainer.
#G10# As a trainer, I want to show my rating up on my profile page, so that site visitors can choose wisely.
Action: Show Rating Up On Profile Page

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to view a section of the website that teaches me the basics of what Scrum is, so that I can learn that quickly.
Action: View A Section Of The Website Teaches Me The Basics What Scrum Is

Text: #G10# As a site editor, I want to create the content of the What Is Scrum section, so that it's there for visitors.
Action: Create The Content The Is Scrum Section

Text: #G10# As a site visitor, I want to view lists on the site of all Certified Scrum Masters, Practitioners, Trainers, and Certified Scrum Product Owners.
Action: View Lists On The Site Of Certified Product Scrum Owner
View Lists On The Site Of Practitioner
View Lists On The Site Of Trainer
View Lists On The Site Of All Certified Scrum Masters

Text: #G10# As a CSM, I want to have my name listed in the registry without becoming a member of the site, so that employers or others can verify my certification.
#G10# As a trainer, I want to load an Excel file into the site, so that the course participants are added to the Scrum Alliance records.
Action: Load An Excel File Into The Site

Text: #G10# As a site admin, I want to view all classes in a pending state, so that I can approve any that need to be approved.
Action: View All Classes In A Pending State

Text: #G10# As a site admin, I want to move people in a trainer's class from a pending state to the registry once I have received proof of payment from the trainer.
Action: Move People In A Trainer's Class From A Pending State To The Registry
Received Proof Of Payment From The Trainer

Text: #G10# As a CSM, I want to be sent an email welcoming me to the Scrum Alliance and with instructions to register or activate my membership once my name has been loaded to the registry.

#G10# As a site editor, I want to edit the content of the email automatically sent to new Certified Scrum Masters and Product Owners, so that I don't need to involve a programmer on simple email edits.
Action: Edit The Content Of The Automatically Email To Product Owner
Edit The Content Of The Automatically Email To Certified, New Scrum Masters

Text: #G10# As a corporatesponsor, I want to display my logo on a corporate sponsors page, so that others see the company's support of Scrum.
Action: Display Logo On A Corporate Sponsors Page

Text: #G10# As a corporatesponsor, I want to make my logo randomly appear on the home page, so that others see the company's support of Scrum.
#G10# As a CSM, I want to be charged a fee once I am approved for Practitioner status, so that my certification status can be activated.
#G10# As a CST, I want to pay an annual fee, so that my CST status is active.
#G10# As a site administrator, I want to set the annual fees for members, Practitioners and Trainers, so that fees can be set without involving a programmer.
Action: Set The Annual Fees For Members
Set The Annual Fees For Trainer
Set The Annual Fees For Practitioner

Text: #G10# As a member, I want to receive a reminder and a link, so that I can renew my membership.
#G10# As a member, I want to have the system email me a new password or a password reminder since i have short-term memory problems.
Action: The System Email Me A New Password Have Short Term Memory Problems

Text: #G10# As a trainer, I want to read information of relevance only to trainers, so that the Scrum Alliance can share information with me easily.
Action: Read Information Of Relevance Only To Trainers

Text: #G10# As a site editor, I want to post information in a trainers-only section, so that only trainers see it.
Action: Post Information In A Only Trainers Section

Text: #G11# As a team member, I want to see the first iteration of beta up on cloud.gov.
Action: See The First Iteration Of Beta Up On Cloud.Gov

Text: #G11# As a developer, I want to have the subdomain beta.nsf.gov be set up, so that I can deploy a beta site to it.
#G11# As a stakeholder, I want to have a decision on whether or not the blog aggregator may work for beta, and if not what will.
Action: Have A Decision Not The Blog Aggregator Work For Beta

Text: #G11# As an NSF employee, I want to understand the process of switching the cloud.gov hosting plan over from prototype to FISMA low.
Action: Understand The Process Switching The Cloud.Gov Hosting Plan Over From Prototype To Low Fisma

Text: #G11# As a stakeholder, I want to see the results of user research, so that I can determine if the CMS is right for me.
Action: See The Results Of User Research

Text: #G11# As a designer, I want to have a new social media wireframe, so that I can begin implementing design.
#G11# As a team member, I want to have a prioritized list of features and elements of a future social element page, so that I can work with the engineers to determine feasibility.
Action: Have A Prioritized List Of Element
Have A Prioritized List Of Features Of A Social, Future Element Page

Text: #G11# As a team member, I want to determine a design direction for the beta social page, so that we can implement a beta site quickly without established brand guidelines.
Action: Determine A Design Direction For The Social, Beta Page

Text: #G11# As a user researcher, I want to test the user research plan, so that I make sure the in-person interviews are effective and capturing the right information.
#G11# As a user researcher, I want to have the finalized OLPA task script, so that I can begin testing with internal users.
Action: Have The Finalized Olpa Task Script

Text: #G11# As a content editor, I want to be able to easily find content, so that I can edit it.
#G11# As a research participant, I want to make sure that the appearance of the prototype does not distract from the workflow, so that I can complete the user interview.
#G11# As a user researcher, I want to have the WIG prototype, so that I can finalize the second task script.
#G11# As a user, I want to add a video to my article.
#G11# As a team member, I want to meet with DIS / cloud.gov, so that I can determine the requirements for the beta.nsf.gov ATO.
#G11# As a user researcher, I want to have a list of priority workflow candidates that we might test, so that I can make sure we're capturing the priority areas.
Action: Have A List Of Workflow, Priority Candidates

Text: #G11# As a team member, I want to understand what the MVP should look like, so that I can begin understanding workflow needs as they pertain to any CMS decision.
#G11# As an NSF administrator, I want to shadow the CMS implementation, so that I can learn as the prototype is developed further.
#G11# As a team member, I want to have an updated acquisitions roadmap, so that I can plan accordingly.
#G11# As an NSF employee, I want to have an updated roadmap document, so that I can see prioritized areas to focus on for the next few months and beyond.
#G11# As a team member, I want to understand how time off overlaps with plans around the user research.
Action: Understand How Time With Plans Around The User Research

Text: #G11# As a researcher, I want to develop the user research protocol for internal workflows, so that we can begin testing against a CMS prototype.
Action: Develop The User Research Protocol For Internal Workflows

Text: #G11# As an NSF employee, I want to narrow down the universe of CMS options and identify/prioritize key considerations for getting to the next step.
Action: Narrow Down The Universe Of Cms Options
Prioritize Key Considerations Getting To The Next Step

Text: #G11# As an NSF employee, I want to have a final workshop to identify key lessons and features for the content management system decision.
Action: Identify Key Lessons For The Content Management System Decision

Text: #G11# As a CMS SME, I want to see the webmaster workflow report, so that I can understand how this might impact current direction.
#G11# As an NSF employee, I want to understand work performed, so that I can understand when and what I can use later.
#G11# As a researcher, I want to recruit for the last round of user research, so that we can summarize our findings and synthesize results.
Action: Recruit For The Last Round Of User Research

Text: #G11# As a user researcher, I want to continue scheduling interviews for hypothesis #1, so that I can be prepared to test our first prototype.
#G11# As an NSF employee, I want to have high-level strategy recommendations to implement in conjunction with the new CMS.
Action: Implement In Conjunction With The New Cms

Text: #G11# As an NSF employee, I want to have editorial-planning recommendations, so that I can understand how they might impact an eventual CMS / future web presence.
#G11# As a web recruiter manager, I want to confirm the recruiter is set up and working properly on Science360.gov.
#G11# As an NSF employee, I want to know how visual design directions were developed, so that I can make better design decisions in the future.
#G11# As a team member, I want to know what the first hypothesis is, so that I can start developing a prototype to test.
#G11# As a content designer, I want to develop a better understanding of NSF's content types and editorial plan, so that I can make more informed recommendations going forward.
Action: Develop A Better Understanding Of Editorial Plan
Develop A Better Understanding Of Nsf's Content Types

Text: #G11# As a team member, I want to have a prototype strategy, so that I understand how we will gain understandings from tests that will drive recommendations.
#G11# As a content designer, I want to demonstrate the value of user-centered content design to ensure it's an integral part of our recommendations.
Action: Demonstrate The Value Of User, Centered Content Design 'S An Integral Part Of Recommendations

Text: #G11# As a user researcher, I want to know when outreach to lists is successful, so that I can plan on a new release to the next listserv on the priority list.
#G11# As an NSF employee, I want to schedule regular in-person check-ins, so that we can continue to communicate the goals of the project with our stakeholders.
Action: Schedule Person In, Regular Check Ins

Text: #G11# As a developer, I want to know what the three initial hypotheses are, so that I can plan work around development of prototypes.
#G11# As a workshop attendee, I want to have a summary of what we learned, so that I can understand our next steps and how they apply to me.
#G11# As a designer, I want to know what early indications of hypotheses might be, so that I can start planning for the first prototype.
#G11# As a team member, I want to have a schedule of more coworking slots, so that I can work in tandem with the rest of the team on a more regular basis.
Action: Have A Schedule Of More Coworking Slots

Text: #G11# As an NSF person interested in attending user interviews, I want to know when they are scheduled and the type of user that will be interviewed.
#G11# As an NSF member of the team, I want to have a place where I can access all the related reports and documentation, so that I can refer to it easily now and in the future.
#G11# As a team member, I want to know when the mid-point checkin is and what will be covered, so that I can plan accordingly.
#G11# As an NSF employee, I want to join Github, so that I can participate in the issues as assigned.
#G11# As an NSF employee, I want to learn about how Github is used, so that I can participate in the issues as assigned.
#G11# As a VisualDesigner, I want to concept different styles for the nsf.gov website, so that we can discuss different design concepts with stakeholders.
Action: Concept Different Styles For The Nsf.Gov Website

Text: #G11# As a user researcher, I want to set up a website recruitment test, so that I can see if we can recruit users in real time from the website.
Action: Set Up A Website Recruitment Test

Text: #G11# As a web recruiter manager, I want to confirm the recruiter is set up and working properly, so that I can deploy it on more pages.
#G11# As a VisualDesigner, I want to create a moodboard to aid with visual design concepts for the nsf.gov website, so that we can discuss different design concepts with stakeholders.
Action: Aid With Visual Design Concepts For The Nsf.Gov Website

Text: #G11# As a workshop attendee, I want to see a summary on major findings from the event.
Action: See A Summary On Major Findings From The Event

Text: #G11# As a user researcher, I want to make sure the correct NSF people are invited to user interviews, so that they can observe the interviews and make recommendations accordingly.
#G11# As a user researcher, I want to begin drafting a research plan, so that I can begin recruiting participants.
#G11# As a content editor, I want to be able to add videos from Brightcove.
#G11# As a VisualDesigner, I want to demonstrate the value of visual design to the NSF project team, so that visual design is an integral part of a redesign.
Action: Demonstrate The Value Of Visual Design To The Nsf Project Team

Text: #G11# As a team member, I want to know what visual design related tasks we might need to plan for this sprint, so that I can assign tasks as necessary.
#G11# As a team member, I want to have recruiting-email templates ready to go, so that I can start recruiting interviewees ASAP!.
#G11# As an NSF employee, I want to see how the user recruitment form looks and behaves on a sample page, so that I can understand the impact the recruitment will have on the NSF page.
Action: Behaves The User Recruitment Form On A Sample Page

Text: #G11# As a potential research participant, I want to learn about the research and leave my contact information.
#G11# As a team member, I want to have a high-level sense of the project timeline, so that I can plan my work.
Action: Have A High Level Sense Of The Project Timeline

Text: #G11# As a site administrator, I want to understand how other similar organizations are handling visual design, so that I can make informed decisions about what appears to work well and what doesn't.
#G11# As a team member, I want to have a platform that allows me to rapidly prototype HTML ideas.
#G11# As a user researcher, I want to conduct a user definition workshop with NSF, so that I can better prepare them and the team for future research work.
Action: Conduct A User Definition Workshop With Nsf

Text: #G11# As an NSF employee, I want to know where the initial in-person meeting will be, so that I can plan on attending.
#G11# As a designer, I want to have a style guide / design guide / content guide, so that we have a uniform way of delivering product.
#G11# As a team member, I want to know when meetings are, so that I can plan accordingly.
#G11# As a team member, I want to understand how work moves between UX/content > visual design > front end dev for a sprint cycle.
Action: Visual Understand How Work Moves Between Ux Front, > End Dev For A Sprint Cycle

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to create a new game by entering a name and an optional description, so that I can start inviting estimators.
Action: Create A New Game Entering An Optional Description
Create A New Game Entering A Name

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to invite estimators by giving them a URL where they can access the game, so that we can start the game.
Action: Invite Estimators Giving Them A Url Where Access The Game

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to start a round by entering an item in a single multi-line text field, so that we can estimate it.
Action: Start A Round Entering An Item In A Line, Single Text Field

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to see all items we try to estimate this session, so that I can answer questions about the current story such as "does this include ___".
#G13# As a moderator, I want to select an item to be estimated or re-estimated, so that the team sees that item and can estimate it.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to add an item to the list of items to be estimated, so that so that we can be flexible and accommodate situations where we think of a new story while playing.
Action: Add An Item To The List Of Items To Estimated

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to edit an item in the list of items to be estimated, so that I can make it better reflect the team's understanding of the item.
Action: Edit An Item In The List Of Items To Estimated

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to delete an item from the list of items to be estimated, so that we can remove it and not estimate it.
Action: Delete An Item From The List Of Items To Estimated

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to show all estimates immediately, so that I can decide to show the estimates that have been given even though not all estimators have given their estimate.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to accept the average of all estimates, so that we can move on to the next item when we agree.
Action: Accept The Average Of All Estimates

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to have the "estimate" field filled in automatically if all estimators show the same card, so that I can accept it more quickly.
Action: Have The Automatically Estimate Field In

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to enter the agreed-upon estimate, so that we can move on to the next item when we agree.

#G13# As a moderator, I want to estimate a story we estimated earlier in the session again, so that we can give a new estimate if we feel different about the story after estimating other related stories.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to import stories from a spreadsheet, so that I don't have to copy and paste each individual story.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to copy/paste stories from a spreadsheet, so that I can get started more quickly.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to browse through previous games, so that I can find the previous game I'm looking for.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to view a transcript of a game, so that I can see the stories and estimates.
Action: View A Transcript Of A Game

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to export a transcript of a game as a HTML file, so that I can save the stories and estimates locally.
Action: Export A Transcript Of A Game As A Html File

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to export a transcript of a game as a CSV file, so that I can further process the stories and estimates.
Action: Export A Transcript Of A Game As A Csv File

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to delete a game, so that stories and estimates for this game are no longer stored.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to create an account for the application by entering my name, email address, a password and a username, so that I can start using the application.
Action: Create An Account For The Application Entering A Username
Create An Account For The Application Entering Email Address
Create An Account For The Application Entering Name
Create An Account For The Application Entering A Password

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to log in using my account name and password, so that I can start using the application.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to change my account details, so that I can keep my account details up-to-date.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to delete my account, so that account information and games are no longer stored.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to see dates and times in my local timezone, so that I don't have to do timezone conversion myself.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to get a password reminder by email, so that I can get back to using the application when I've forgotten my password.
Action: Get A Password Reminder By Email

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to select whether to have the team estimate with {0, 1/2, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, etc.} or {0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, etc.}, so that the team can use either the modified Fibonacci sequence or powers of 2.
Action: Select The Team Estimate With 0 Etc

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to invite up to 15 estimators, so that we can play with large but not immense teams.
#G13# As an estimator, I want to join a game by entering my name on the page I received the URL for, so that I can participate.
Action: Join A Game Entering Name On The Page

Text: #G13# As an estimator, I want to see the item we're estimating, so that I know what I'm giving an estimate for.
#G13# As an estimator, I want to see all items we will try to estimate this session, so that I have a feel for the sizes of the various items.
#G13# As a participant, I want to immediately see that an estimate has been given by a specific estimator, so that I know who has already given an estimate and who we're still waiting for.

#G13# As a participant, I want to be shown all estimates at the same time after all estimators have given their estimate, so that I can be sure estimates are independent and not influenced by other estimates given in the same draw.
Action: Shown All Estimates At The Same Time

Text: #G13# As a participant, I want to be able to change my estimate up until the last person selects a card and all are shown, so that I can change my mind based on information I hear.
#G13# As a participant, I want to be able to see each estimator's prior estimates for the story being estimated, so that I can see how his or her opinion has changed so I can ask questions.
Action: See Each Estimator's Prior Estimates The Story Estimated

Text: #G13# As a participant, I want to see who gave what estimates during the current round, so that I know this when we're discussing the estimates.

#G13# As a participant, I want to be able start a two-minute countdown timer that all participants can see, so that I can limit the time spent discussing the estimates when I think we've talked long enough.
Action: Start A Minute Countdown Timer That All Participants See

Text: #G13# As a participant, I want to have the two-minute timer reset itself as soon as we all play an estimate, so that it's ready for use on the next round.
Action: The Timer Soon As Reset Itself All Play
The Minute Timer Soon As Reset Play An Estimate

Text: #G13# As a participant, I want to scroll back through the stories and estimates from prior rounds, so that I can use this information when I estimate the item of the current round.
Action: Scroll Through The Stories From Prior Rounds

Text: #G13# As a participant, I want to always have the cards in the same order across multiple draws, so that it's easy to compare estimates.
Action: Have The Cards In The Same Order Across Multiple Draws

Text: #G13# As a participant, I want to have a small thumbnail photo displayed near where my cards are played, so that the game is more personal because I see who I'm estimating with.
Action: Have A Small Thumbnail Photo Cards Where Played

Text: #G13# As a developer, I want to have written a site which is compliant with XHTML and CSS standards, so that as many people as possible can access the site and view it as intended.
Action: Written A Site Is Compliant With Css Standard
Written A Site Is Compliant With Xhtml

Text: #G13# As a developer, I want to have a list of definitions for commonly used terms, so that everyone working on the project can understand each other more easily.
Action: Have A List Of Definitions For Commonly Used Terms

Text: #G13# As a developer, I want to have created database indexes, so that the queries run as fast as possible.

#G13# As a developer, I want to have the application function correctly in Internet Explorer 6 and 7, Firefox 1.5 and 2, and Safari 2, so that as many people as possible can fully use the application.
Action: Have The Application Function In Internet Explorer 2 1.5

Text: #G13# As a developer, I want to have the site comply with the W3C accessibility guidelines where possible, so that people with accessibility issues can use the application.
#G13# As a user, I want to have the application respond quickly to my actions, so that I don't get bored.
#G13# As a user, I want to be able to use Unicode, so that I can use any language I like.
#G13# As a user, I want to see sensible and predictable URLs, so that the application feels logical and transparent.
#G13# As a user, I want to have nice error pages when something goes wrong, so that I can trust the system and its developers.
#G13# As a Mike, I want to be able to see some metrics on use of the game, so that I can see how much it is being used.
Action: See Some Metrics On Use Of The Game
